_header: Friendship faileth and fully fadeth / Faithful friends few
_description: ‘Fy on a feynt Frende’ — nine 8-line stanzas, ababbcbc, alliterating and with a refrain, ‘And þer fy on a feynt frende’

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Frenschipe faileþ & fullich fadeþffeiþful
                    frendes fewe we fynde…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Do we so þat crist beo payetAnd þenne we hauen a
                    syker frend
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BLAdd22283.First Lines:
FRenschupe faileþ & fullich fadeþ[F]eiþeful
                    frendes fewe we fynde…
BLAdd22283.Last Lines:
…Dow we so þat crist be payidAnd þenne we hauen a
                    syker frend
BLAdd22283.Note:
The initial ‘F’ is supplied by the ornamental letter of the
                    first line.
BLAdd22283.Attributed Title: Explicit A song ffy on a feynt frend (f. 130va)
